metadata.titel_preek: The Master and the Best Man

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The identification and proclamation of Jesus as the unique, divine Savior (the Bridegroom) who enters a world in a 'desperate fix' to bring salvation, distinct from all other spiritual masters.

tekstueel_bewijs: the one in whose person the Kingdom of God has arrived
the one and only Lord of lasting peace and justice is on his way

object.identificatie: Salvation / The Revelation of Christ's Identity

tekstueel_bewijs: begotten of his father before all worlds
the human race is in a desperate fix
all the people of the world
sinners in need of a Savior

helper.identificatie: John the Baptist / The Preacher / The Church Tradition (Nicene Creed)
tekstueel_bewijs: John’s function... is to leave no doubt about Jesus’ identity
The preacher today... has nothing to give you but Jesus
the cross going ahead of us

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin / Human Optimism / Religious Pluralism / Sentimentalism
tekstueel_bewijs: the human race is in a desperate fix
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad behavior but a fundamental ontological 'fix' and the blindness of human religion that tries to save itself.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The response of the believer (exemplified by John the Baptist and Aunt Mary Virginia) to 'decrease' so that Christ may 'increase'.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer / John the Baptist
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (witness/joy) is a direct result of the primary program (Christ's arrival). The human subject acts only to point away from self.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: God the Father → Jesus Christ (Salvation) → The Human Race
actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: John the Baptist/Creeds → Jesus Christ ← Sin/Human Optimism
actantieel_schema_visualisatie.subject_naar_object: Jesus Christ → Redemption of the 'Desperate Fix'

voorbeelden_god_subject: the Kingdom of God has arrived
voorbeelden_mens_subject: John the Baptist is the central personage
the human race does not need any more spiritual masters

voorbeelden: He must increase, but I must decrease
it was necessary for the church leaders to get together
One must love the Dalai Lama for that
leave no doubt about Jesus’ identity
the human race is in a desperate fix [humanity lacks power]
the one and only Lord... is on his way [God has power]

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the total inability (lack of Pouvoir) of the human race to save itself through 'spiritual techniques' and emphasizes the unique power of Christ's person.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from ~S2 (Dalai Lama's optimism) to S2 (The LIRR massacre/Yonkers shooting) to ~S1 (Masters/Gere) and finally to S1 (The Nicene Christ).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved not by human effort but by the arrival of the 'Bridegroom' who is 'Very God of Very God'.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the sermon explicitly rejects 'solipsistic banalities' for the reality of murder and a 'desperate fix'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. It explicitly deconstructs human 'spiritual techniques' and 'optimism' to place Christ as the sole active Subject of salvation.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: John has set the example for us all.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The human race does not need any more spiritual masters; it needs a Savior.
Jesus is not a master in the sense of a teacher who simply leads his disciples along the same path that he himself treads.

exemplarism_check.beschrijving: John the Baptist is used as an example, but specifically an example of 'decreasing' and pointing away from self, which subverts traditional moralism.
exemplarism_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides this: John is not the hero, but the 'best man' whose joy comes from the Bridegroom's arrival.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and comfort; the burden of 'spiritual mastery' is removed.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation; Christ's personhood is the ground of being.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The narrative hierarchy is perfectly maintained: the primary program of God's intervention in Christ grounds the secondary program of human witness.
spanning_punten: The tension between the 'humorous, savvy' Dalai Lama and the 'desperate fix' of the world.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: He must increase, but I must decrease... sinners in need of a Savior.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is not explicitly mentioned, though the 'joy' of John suggests an internal endowment.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; described as a 'desperate fix' evidenced by random violence.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully positions Christ as the Subject and the human as the Receiver/Witness.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Increase Pouvoir (The actual 'doing' of the Savior)
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Explicitly mention how the 'Master' breaks the power of the 'desperate fix' in the present.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Strongly defined through the LIRR massacre example.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in theocentric preaching, using the actantial role of 'Best Man' to keep the focus entirely on the 'Bridegroom'.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis would focus on the use of the New York Times and Vanity Fair as 'hooks'; Greimas shows these are actually 'Opponents' (false Senders) in the narrative structure.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would focus on the Greek of John 3; Greimas shows how the 'I must decrease' is a modal shift from human Devoir to divine Pouvoir.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Aunt Mary Virginia' story is not just an illustration but a 'Transmission' event where the Object (Jesus) is passed to the Receiver.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Master' title as a semiotic battleground, redefining it from 'Teacher' (Moralism) to 'Lord' (Grace).
